>>Weather Santa Maria

The climate here is considered warm and temperate. It has been observed that Santa Maria experiences a greater amount of precipitation during the winter season as compared to the summer months. According to Köppen and Geiger, this climate is classified as Csc. The mean yearly temperature observed in Santa Maria is recorded to be 15.3 °C | 59.5 °F. Each year, there is an approximate 436 mm | 17.2 inch of precipitation that occurs.

The specified area is located in the northern hemisphere of our planet. The onset of summer commences towards the conclusion of June and culminates by September. The season is characterized by a sequence of months, namely: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Santa Maria

In July, the precipitation level plummets to a mere 1 mm | 0.0 inch. This month holds the title for being exceptionally arid. The month of January experiences the highest amount of precipitation, with an average value of 99 mm | 3.9 inch.

average temperature by month Santa Maria

The month of highest temperature is August during which the average temperature reaches up to 20.1 °C | 68.2 °F. The month of December is characterized by the lowest temperatures, which have an average reading of 10.6 °C | 51.1 °F.

It has been observed that February exhibits the highest relative humidity, with a percentage of 71.75. On the other hand, October experiences the lowest relative humidity at an approximate rate of 61.72. According to the data, February is observed as the month with maximum rainy days (8.13) while August has recorded minimum rainfall during its tenure (0.17).

Total hours of sun

Within the region of Santa Maria, the month that experiences a maximum number of daily hours with bright sunshine is June exhibiting an average duration of approximately 10.43. In totality, there are about 323.22 hours worth of sunlight throughout this particular period.

On average, the location of Santa Maria experiences the least number of daily hours with sunshine during January. The total duration of sunlight in this period is recorded as 234.42, while an average of about 7.56 hours are received per day.

Throughout the year, Santa Maria experiences approximately 3356.08 hours of sunshine. The average monthly duration of sunlight is estimated to be around 110.26.
